alert.note: Alert for Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; Northern Monterey Bay; San Francisco; San Fransisco Peninsula Coast; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued December 26 at 9:48AM PST until December 27 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TUESDAY TO 9 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Beach Hazards Statement, surf heights of 12 to 17 feet expected. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 20 to 25 feet expected. * WHERE...San Francisco, Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore, San Francisco Peninsula Coast, Northern Monterey Bay and Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast. * WHEN... For the Beach Hazards Statement, through 9 AM Tuesday morning. For the High Surf Advisory, from 9 AM Tuesday to 9 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Large shorebreak. Farther than normal wave runup. Some beaches will be inundated at high tide. Rounding or climbing over rock outcroppings will be extremely dangerous. Fishing off rock walls or jetties may wash you out to sea. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The ocean is an unrelenting environment with little to no chance of rescue. Respect this force of nature and remain well away from hazardous ocean conditions.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.

area.areaDesc: Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; Northern Monterey Bay; San Francisco; San Fransisco Peninsula Coast; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast
